data.title: Missing Types in EffectMaterialReader
Set line height when processing sprite fonts.
data.body: This fixes an issue where the SpriteFont processor calculates but doesn't set the line height.

data.title: iOS SoundEffect requirements
data.body:
What does an audio file (.wav) need to be playable on iOS/OS X?
I've tried with a lot of .wav files within all the bitrates possible. Some were signed 16-bit PCM, other ones were unsigned 8-bit PCM.

I've tried processing them to .xnb, but with no success too. (I'm not able to generate .xnb ones for audio files on OS X, I get this error: "Error: Processor 'SoundEffectProcessor' had unexpected failure!").

I know that there is no problem on coding, since it worked with an .xnb file I get from an internet sample.

I tried with a lot files from MonoGame-Samples and MonoGame-StarterKit too.

Thanks in advance.

data.title: Set GamePadState to partial to allow platform-specific extensions.
data.body:
Each platform's controller has some unique features allowing some additional information on a per-player basis. While there's some overlap among them (accelerometers in the Wii and PS4 for instance), there are always going to be some inputs that are specific to a platform that can't be mimicked on others.

With this change the structure itself can be extended, meaning you don't have do additional GamePad(PlayerIndex) queries to get a platform-specific feature.

data.title: Monogame 3.0.1 => Windows Store App => GCLatencyMode.LowLatency => freezes
data.body:
When porting my XNA game to MonoGame for running it on Windows 8.1, I noticed that after a minute or so, it was completely freezing (100% CPU), although no exceptions were thrown, and breaking the debugger didn't give any clue what was happening either. 

After a couple of days I found the culprit

To reproduce: 
make a new Windows Store App using the MonoGame 3.0.1 VS template
change the Draw call so it flashes the screen e.g. between black and white.
in the game constructor, add the line GCSettings.LatencyMode = GCLatencyMode.LowLatency;
start the game, and keep tapping with multiple fingers on the screen.
after a couple of seconds, the screen freezes.
My system is a Surface Pro 2 128GB, Windows 8.1 x64, and I also have a Wacom Bamboo Fun tablet attached.

I wonder if other people experience the same issue?

PS: Curiously, setting the latency to SustainedLowLatency (which I guess is the best setting for games?) does NOT freeze the game

data.title: Update Protobuild
data.body: This addresses #2274.  On Mac OS, Protobuild will generate projects with Xamarin Mac GUIDs if Xamarin Mac is installed, otherwise it will default to MonoMac GUIDs.

data.title: Fix loading TextureCubes in background threads on OpenGL platforms.
data.body: At present, loading a TextureCube in a background thread fails to work on OpenGL platforms because it doesn't invoke to the UI thread for the OpenGL calls in PlatformConstruct and PlatformSetData like Texture2D does. This pull request should be a simple fix for that.

data.title: Add support for loading indexed image files into a texture through Texture2D.FromStream
data.body: This resolves mono/MonoGame#806 and can be useful if loading images from external sources for use as textures, so I think it could be worth incorporating into MonoGame proper. This should retain the same behaviour as before for non-indexed images. It isn't quite as pretty as the old code, though, because indexed images aren't processed in place.

data.body: Replicating implementation on GetValueSingleArray.

Hi!

data.title: Dependencies
data.body:
This pull request replaces the old dependencies repo [kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies](https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies) with a new [Mono-Game/MonoGame.Dependencies](https://github.com/Mono-Game/MonoGame.Dependencies) repo.  This does a few things:
- Moves the dependencies to a repo the team controls.
- Makes the git download smaller as we threw away unneeded old history.
- Renames the folder from Libs to Dependencies which makes more sense.

Downstream forks will only need to do a normal submodule init/update to get the new folder.  To remove the old files you will need to manually delete the `ThirdParty\Libs` folder.  Unfortunately git doesn't make this any easier.

data.title: ResourceContentManager not located in MS.XNA.Framework.Content?
data.body:
I've referenced MonoGame.Framework 3.0.1.0 in my project. The following code produces an error:

```
Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ResourceContentManager m_Content = new Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ResourceContentManager(Services, ResContent.ResourceManager);
```

The error is:

```
The type or namespace name 'ResourceContentManager' does not exist in the namespace 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content' (are you missing an assembly reference?)
```

Looking in the object browser, I see that ResourceContentManager is not located in Monogame's Content namespace.

Should I be referencing anything else?

data.title: Property for enable/disable ALT+F4 combo
data.body: In some cases, for some application with monogame, usage of alt+f4 for closing window is not advisable. What if developer wants to decrease the number of legal ways for closing app or want to use this combo with KeyboardState for his/her own purposes ? (example: shows in-game closing dialog by pressing alt+f4 instead immediate shutdown) So, why not add new possibility for developers ? The property called GameWindow.AllowAltF4. By default its true => nothing changed for existing apps.  It works on WindowsDX and all OpenTK derived projects, but not on WinRT. It does not affect performance, nor standart window closing procedure(by click). If name(AllowAltF4) is not desirable I rename it to your version - suggest.

data.title: Windows Phone 8 monogame and background losing textures?
data.body:
This might be a feature rather than a bug, but I have an app that uses most of the GPU memory on the device. When I put it to the background and return to the app, it appears that some of the textures have been released from the memory and they're not being rendered anymore.
Since I feel that this is an issue I should probably address in the code, how can I detect & reload missing textures when returning from the background?

data.title: Can I use MonoGame instead of XNA?
data.body:
This is more of a question than an issue, but I wasn't sure where to ask, and the documentation is unclear. Many people I've talked to assume that MonoGame is meant to replace XNA, as XNA is no longer in development, but I get the impression MonoGame is actually dependent on XNA.

The [Getting Started](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/wiki/Tutorials%3Agettingstarted) tutorial says that XNA is required:

```
To develop on a Windows box you will need at a minimum

    * Visual Studio 2010 Express or Above or MonoDevelop/Xamarin Studio
    * XNA 4.0 Game Studio
    * Windows Phone 7 SDK
    * OpenAL installed.

There is a requirement for XNA Game studio to allow you to compile content into .xnb format, this can be done using the Windows Phone SDK's but if you are using or plan to use custom shaders you will need the XNA tool chain as the Windows Phone SDK's do not support shaders. 
```

However [Windows Prerequisites](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/wiki/Tutorials%3Aprerequisites) doesn't list XNA:

```
1. Install Mono: http://www.mono-project.com/Main_Page
    i. Click the "Download" link
    ii. Select your operating system under "Long-term Supported Version"
    iii. Select the specific download. On Windows, select "Mono for Windows, Gtk#, and XSP"
2. Install OpenTK: http://www.opentk.com/
3. Install MonoDevelop 2.8+: http://monodevelop.com/
    i. The website for MonoDevelop will mention that you need GTK. If you installed Mono, you will have GTK
    ii. If you are installing the Windows binary confirm that you have .NET 4.0 and GTK# for .NET 2.12.10 mentioned here: http://monodevelop.com/Download
4. Install msysgit (this must be done before installing TortoiseGit on Windows): http://code.google.com/p/msysgit/
    i. You will want to download the "Net installer" or "Full installer" for msysgit. For example, "msysGit-fullinstall-1.7.4-preview20110204.exe"
5. Install TortoiseGit: http://code.google.com/p/tortoisegit/
```

So can I use MonoGame instead of XNA, or is XNA required?

data.title: Cannot build MonoGame source on Xaramin for Mac
data.body:
I am trying to set up MonoGame on my Mac.  
I am running:
- OS X 10.9.2
- Xaramin 4.2.3
- MonoMac MDK 3.2.7
- MonoMac MRE 3.2.7

I want to set up MonoGame on my Mac so I start on a project.  However, when I try to run a test project from the MonoGame template, the application just bounces in the dock forever.
Thus, I found on the internet a convoluted process of setting up MonoGame on Mac located here: https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/471565

Now I have it another road block.  When I try to build the MonoGame source to generate the needed .dlls, I get 3 build errors (and 67 warnings, but I am not sure if those are intended).

The 3 build errors are: 
- /Users/danb91/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Texture2D.cs(27,27): Error CS1502: The best overloaded method match for 'MonoMac.AppKit.NSImage.AsCGImage(ref System.Drawing.RectangleF, MonoMac.AppKit.NSGraphicsContext, MonoMac.Foundation.NSDictionary)' has some invalid arguments (CS1502) (MonoGame.Framework.MacOS)  for line 623: `var cgImage = nsImage.AsCGImage (RectangleF.Empty, null, null);`
- /Users/danb91/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Texture2D.cs(49,49): Error CS1620: Argument '#1' is missing 'ref' modifier (CS1620) (MonoGame.Framework.MacOS) for line 623: `var cgImage = nsImage.AsCGImage (RectangleF.Empty, null, null);`
- /Users/danb91/Downloads/MonoGame-3.0.1.0/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Texture2D.cs(17,17): Error CS0411: The type arguments for method 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.SetData<T>(T[])' cannot be inferred from the usage. Try specifying the type arguments explicitly (CS0411) (MonoGame.Framework.MacOS) for line 641: `texture.SetData(data);`

How do I get past these compilation errors?  Am I missing some sort of dependency?    Instead of compiling the MonoGame source, is there someplace I can just get the prebuilt dll's for Mac?

Also: Why aren't the proper dll's included with the .mpack?  Are there no Mac build servers?  Is there anything I can do to help?

Please excuse any ignorant questions.  Thanks very much for the help!

data.title: SoundEffectInstance not working on Android
data.body:
#2275 seems to have broke audio on Android (not sure if also on all OpenAL platforms).

Sound just does not play.

I just made a very quick check at SoundEffectInstance.OpenAL.cs, and i think sourceId is never being set on Android, at least not on a possible code path.
Everything seems to be broke here.
Just look at PlatformPlay method. It checks

```
if (sourceId == 0)
    return;
```

but, on Android, sourceId is only set later at this method... So s_soundPool.Play will never play.

Also, _soundId is always -1, and the only place that is could be set is here:

```
internal SoundEffect(string fileName)
```

but this method is never called.
#2275 broke Android's SoundEffect/SoundEffectInstance for good...

data.title: Support for Texture2D.FromStream on WP8
data.body:
As per #2106
Almost the same as #1948, only difference is that instead of DecodeJpeg it uses the more universal BitmapImage to decode the image.

data.title: Texture2D.DirectX problems
data.body:
I have noticed some problems with the Texture2D.DirectX file:
1) It has some #if MONOMAC parts
2) Texture2D PlatformFromStream looks like this:

``` C#
#if WINDOWS_PHONE
[...]
#endif
#if !WINDOWS_PHONE
[...]
#endif
#if WINDOWS
[...]
#endif
```

This looks strange to me and results in two returns if WINDOWS is definied (one from !WINDOWS_PHONE, one from WINDOWS).

data.title: Protobuild script targets .NET 3.5 on Windows GL build
data.body:
In the MG windows GL build on a windows 8 box with only .NET 4, the lidgren build fails:

```
             [exec]   C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\Microsoft.Common.targets(983,5): error MSB3645: .NET Framework v3.5 Service Pack 1 was not found. In order to target ".NETFramework,Version=v3.5", .NET Framework v3.5 Service Pack 1 or later must be installed. 
```

[MonoGame\ThirdParty\Lidgren.Network\Lidgren.Network.Windows.csproj]

Looks like the protobuild script is generating targets for v3.5 instead of 4?

data.title: Reload asset link fix
data.body: ReloadGraphicsAssets - ReloadAsset being removed on linkage. #2232

data.title: SoundEffect FromStream causes a crash
data.body:
According to @tomspilman, FromStream now hits https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffect.XAudio.cs#L177 and causes a crash.  We use FromStream in Protogame to play audio since the content compiler can't do non-Windows audio compilation yet.

CC: @RayBatts

data.title: Split MediaPlayer/Song on a per-API basis
data.body:
This PR is similar to https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2251 and https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2270

The goal being to help clean up the multiple implementations of MediaPlayer/Song by merging the multiple source files into a single partial class. This'll allow for platforms to easily be added later, as well as share common code between them. (null checks, variable setting, etc). 

This PR doesn't contain any functional changes.

NOTE: This was branched from https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2275 Merge this PR after that one's been closed out.
